quote: A person who makes few mistakes makes little progress.
author: Bryant McGill
category: errors, learning, lessons, making-mistakes, mistakes, progress, success

quote: Do not let your grand ambitions stand in the way of small but meaningful accomplishments.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: Ambition is not what a man would do, but what a man does, for ambition without action is fantasy.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: Sometimes You Just Gotta Stay Silent Cause No Words Can Explain The Shit Thats Going On In Your Mind And Heart
author: Bryant McGill

quote: We must throw out the old, fear-based thought-forms and evolve, and begin to live as higher beings of compassion.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: You would not believe what skill, power and ability your total intelligence possesses until you are in desperate need.
author: Bryant McGill
category: abilities, desperation, intelligence, neediness, power, skills

quote: There is nothing higher-class than real craftsmanship, diversity, originality and the service of skilled human hands.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: Every word you speak is a prayer, or meditation of reinforcement which creates permanence.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: Your burdens and pains will only be lightened by living ever so fully.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: Suffering is one of life's great teachers.
author: Bryant McGill
category: growth, humility, learning, lessons, loss, pain, suffering, trials

quote: Knowledge is that possession that no misfortune can destroy, no authority can revoke, and no enemy can control. This makes knowledge the greatest of all freedoms.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: When we are quiet and still we contract and settle.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: The ability to forgive is one of man’s greatest achievements.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: The fullness of life's balancing grace will demand the symmetry of recompense for all your loss and pain.
author: Bryant McGill
category: balance, fullness, grace, loss, pain, recompense

quote: Make no mistake about it, no matter how kind, meek, humble and soft your giving heart is — you are a warrior!
author: Bryant McGill

quote: A mistake made by many people with great convictions is that they will let nothing stand in the way of their views, not even kindness.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: Loneliness and desperation are only possible when we have lost touch with our beauty within.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: Toxic relationships are dangerous to your health; they will literally kill you. Stress shortens your lifespan. Even a broken heart can kill you. There is an undeniable mind-body connection. Your arguments and hateful talk can land you in the emergency room or in the morgue. You were not meant to live in a fever of anxiety; screaming yourself hoarse in a frenzy of dreadful, panicked fight-or-flight that leaves you exhausted and numb with grief. You were not meant to live like animals tearing one another to shreds. Don't turn your hair gray. Don't carve a roadmap of pain into the sweet wrinkles on your face. Don't lay in the quiet with your heart pounding like a trapped, frightened creature. For your own precious and beautiful life, and for those around you — seek help or get out before it is too late. This is your wake-up call!
author: Bryant McGill
category: abuse-survivors, anxiety, healing, healing-insights, mind-body-connection, recovery, spirit, stress, toxic-friends, toxic-people, toxic-relationships

quote: Big mistakes are an outstanding opportunity to showcase your ability to recover and have grace under pressure.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: Real transformation requires real honesty. If you want to move forward — get real with yourself!
author: Bryant McGill

quote: When you are avoiding your pain you are really only avoiding your growth.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: Your unstoppable nature is becoming and blooming — you simply, are. Go easy.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: If you want relief from pain just strive to touch more of every part of life.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: Crossing the Rubicon of absolute pain is the only journey of purpose and meaning in life.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: When the storm rips you to pieces, you have to decide how to put yourself back together again.
author: Bryant McGill
category: broken, healing, healing-the-past, pieces, rebuilding, rebuilding-one-s-self, shattered, shattered-souls, storm

quote: If you avoid your truthful emotions and pain you will implode and contract into a diminished and feeble state.
author: Bryant McGill
category: avoidance, emotional-pain, emotions, healing, healing-insights, inner-pain, pain-diminish, spirituality, teaching

quote: Pain is like a healing emotional fever.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: There is an intelligent healing process inside of you that knows how to absorb pain and transform it into wisdom.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: The most powerful tools of revolution through intention are humility and consciousness.
author: Bryant McGill
category: awareness, brave, consciousness, fight, humility, powerful

quote: It is better to have a fair intellect that is well used, than a powerful one that is idle.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: The secret to discovery is to never believe existing facts.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: Having a sense of purpose is having a sense of self. A course to plot is a destination to hope for.
author: Bryant McGill
category: direction, forethought, ideas, planning, purpose, thinking

quote: You will be a beautiful person, as long as you see the beauty in others.
author: Bryant McGill
category: attitude, beautiful, beauty, judgement, perspective, projection

quote: The subtle whispers, cues and nudges are there as guideposts, to gently carry the humble listener along the path back to the source and the true self.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: Surrender is not a weakness, but rather an empowering state of humility.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: We must resist impulses to attack people, their credibility or their nature, and focus only on sharing our own positive creations, contributions, ideas and solutions.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: One of the most sincere forms of respect is actually listening to what another has to say.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: Where wise actions are the fruit of life, wise discourse is the pollination.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: May you receive the wisdom of your wounds and may you live your life even larger than your pain.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: No time is better spent than that spent in the service of your fellow man.
author: Bryant McGill
category: caring, community, humanity, inspirational, service, sharing, spiritual, spirituality, time

quote: The world's only lessons are tension and fear — relax into yourself.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: Quit allowing negativity to block the positive gifts which are meant for you along with the hard lessons and tribulations.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: Accept the fullness in life's balance, which demands that there are positive gifts along with adversity.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: When you release the illusion of control, you begin an effortless free-fall toward a grand reunion with your original self.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: When we become acquainted with any person on a human level, even a great enemy, we begin to see that no person is really so different from ourselves.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: Curiosity is one of the great secrets of happiness.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: Enthusiasm is the energy and force that builds literal momentum of the human soul and mind.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: The outer world is a reflection of our inner selves.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: Genius is always accompanied by enthusiasm.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: Giving is the key to all success in all applications of human life.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: Every generation is inculcated in traditions of prejudice which are encouraged as normal, natural and healthy.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: Because of our interconnectedness we all know that extreme poverty and exclusionary practices are violations against the basic dignity of people.
author: Bryant McGill
